plot: While waiting in his shabby hotel room to hear the results of his race-fixing hearing, washed-up jockey Michael Grady is granted a wish whose fruition means the world to him.

Grady is a champion jockey who has recently been banned from the sport owing to his participation in race fixing and the drugging of horses. He claims he is innocent and currently has an appeal with the racing commission but his agent isn't hopeful. Suddenly, Grady begins hearing a voice - his own as it turns out, speaking to him from his own mind. As Grady rages over the unfairness of it all, he is granted his one true wish.—garykmcd

The jockey Grady has been banned from the races after doping his horse. He claims that he is innocent to the board. Alone in his apartment, he overhears a voice that identifies as his alter-ego. The voice questions what Grady would like to be, and he says "a bigger man"; but not in the sense of a better man. He just wants to be taller. Soon he sees that his wish was granted.—Claudio Carvalho, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
